meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in competition.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outcompete other animals in a race.
meanings.sent2: In the business world, companies strive to outcompete their rivals.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident he could outcompete him.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur managed to outcompete the established companies in the market.
meanings.sent5: Her determination to outcompete her opponents was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: To be more successful than others in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant hopes to outcompete the others in town.
meanings.sent2: Athletes train hard to outcompete their competitors in the upcoming tournament.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outcompete the birds in gathering the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: The small local shop managed to outcompete the big chain stores.
meanings.sent5: His innovative ideas helped him outcompete his colleagues in the project.
